conversations.content: Do you think Saint Starfall will come visit me, Ilia?
Who the heck is Saint Starfall?
I heard about him from the children in town. He brings presents on Dragonyule.
He wears all red, rides a sleigh pulled by reindeer, and passes out presents all night long.
Oh yeah. That guy. I read something about him when I was researching Dragonyule.
He must be a fellow of true skill if he can leave presents by so many people's pillows in a single night!
So what do you think, Ilia? Will Saint Starfall visit me?
Uh...well...maaaaaybe?
(Oh geez, I actually have no idea. I mean, I haven't done THAT much research into the fellow.)
(But I don't wanna give Mordecai some half-baked answer either.)
Gather 'round, children! Today we shall discuss both Dragonyule and Saint Starfall!
YAAAAAY!
Nice timing, church lady! We should lend an ear to this little chat, 'cause I bet the Church knows aaaaall about Saint Starfall.
Okay. I can't wait!

Long, long ago—over a thousand years gone— a great celebration took place. Dragons filled the skies with stars while humans brought  uncountable gifts, all to celebrate the birth of our beloved Goddess Ilia.
But there was one person who did not meet the infant goddess, but instead placed their gift on a tree in front of her home before departing.
According to stories handed down over the long years, this person was the incarnation of the Holywyrm Elysium.
Three centuries later, the benevolent king of a certain land took it upon himself to mimic the particulars of this tale.
He adorned himself with reindeer horns and dressed as Elysium, then traveled his kingdom placing gifts beneath the eaves of homes.
His people spoke of the king's actions through the generations, and now the one who delivers these presents is known as the symbol of Dragonyule—Saint Starfall.
Saint Starfall follows the way of Elysium, who gave a present to the Goddess Ilia.
In other words, he only has gifts for little ones who are good in the Goddess's eyes.
Saint Starfall sees when you are good and when you are naughty, so let's all be good children every single day!
Yaaaaay!
You okay, Mordecai? You don't look so hot.
I would never have thought Saint Starfall was imitating Elysium, of all things.
Also, I cannot imagine that Elysium would think to give you a present after what he did to you.
Yeaaaah, I didn't hear anything like that from Meene or Midgardsormr either.
...Which means there is no Saint Starfall.
Huh?
If Elysium never gave you a present, then no one could have mimicked him.
Which means that Saint Starfall himself is all just a lie...
Oh, Mordecai...
I think he's real.
But the story about Elysium was clearly invented out of whole cloth, no?
I mean, it's PROBABLY not true, but I can't say it's definitely, for sure, one-hundred percent false. It all happened when I was a baby, you know?
Besides, this Saint Starfall has solidified himself as a vital part in the lives of both the children and the Church.
And that means he's got the kind of track record we can believe in.
Ah, I see! Because if the children never received presents, there's no way they would bother believing in him!
Yet the fact remains there are uncountable numbers of children who DO believe.
Ergo, there are lots of people who got loot from the guy!
And that's why I'm pretty certain he's gonna show up for you, Mordecai.
You've just gotta be good and wait like that church lady said.
Got it! Oh, I can't wait to see what Saint Starfall's going to get me!
(Ha! Look how excited he is. I just love how pure and innocent Mordecai can be.)
(But since we can't be sure Saint Starfall is real, I'm gonna stack the deck a bit and just become him.)
(First things first though: I gotta find the PERFECT present for Mordecai!)
Oh man, I have NO idea what to do...
(This is WAY beyond what I could've predicted. I mean, I wanted to get Mordecai whatever he asked for, but...)
Hey, for no particular reason whatsoever, what kind of present were you gonna ask ol' Saint Starfall for?
Your happiness.
Uh...sorry, what?
What I want is for you to be happy.
Well, that's a super sweet thought, but I think Starfall is more about delivering tangible goods, ya know?
And besides, how would you even know if he brought you my happiness or not?
Hmm. That's a fair point.
So why don't you ask him for something you could buy at a store, maybe?
Hmm, yes. In that case...
(NOW I'll get something to work with!)
I want a present that will make you happy!
(Shoulda seen that one coming...)
I never did get an answer on what would make HIM happy. I really should've taught him to be a bit more selfish sometimes...
(I mean, grateful he feels this way, but there's no point to me doing this if it doesn't make him happy, so... Hmm?)
A pendant with a feather motif? Say, that reminds me...
Birds fly in the sky like faeries?
That's right. They have wings just like faeries that let them fly.
That must be nice.
Oh yeah, this could DEFINITELY work.
I'll take this! Huh?!
Oh, I'm sorry!
No, it's my fault.
You went for it first. You should have it.
No, please. You were before me.
Besides, I don't even think he'd like receiving an accessory...
Looking for a Dragonyule present?
Yeah.
Hey, me too! Maybe you can give me some advice on the subject.
I wanna buy a present, but I don't even know where to start.
Probably want to ask someone else; this is my first time picking out a gift for someone.
And I have zero idea what's gonna make him happy.
But when I just flat-out asked what he wanted, he came back with abstract answers like ＂peace and safety for the people.＂
Oh, I very much know how that feels.
You do?
Absolutely. The guy I'm buying a present for couldn't give a straight answer on the subject if I held a dagger to his throat.
I had no idea surprising someone would be so difficult.
Well, since neither of us have a clue as to what we're doing, why don't we figure something out together?
Two heads are better than one, after all!
Sounds good to me.
...Oh man. So you're trying to buy a present for a Paladyn?
A very serious and stubborn Paladyn who desires for absolutely nothing.
Yikes. No wonder you're having trouble finding a gift.
What kind of person are you buying for?
He's kind and pure-hearted and... Well, I guess you'd say he cares about his mom? Kinda embarrassing for me to say that, but it's the truth.
You have a child? But you're so young!
Well, he's not REALLY my kid, but we have a similar sort of relationship.
The outside world has so many kinds of people...
The outside world?
Oh, just talking to mysel—GYA!
Oy! Watch where yer goin', lass!
From where I'm standing, bub, you're the one who ran into her.
Don't blame me, lady—and getch'r damn hands off'a me already, yeah?!
I'll let you go as soon as you give this nice lady her wallet back.
Huh? Hey! My wallet!
Let go'a me!
Like hell you're getting away!
Heh heh! That oughta shake her. Now lessee how much is in—
Gotcha!
Cor blimey!
*gasp* *wheeze* Finally...lost her... But what the hell was that board thing?
You ain't lost nothin'! Haaaaah!
AAAAUGH!
And that's one wallet retrieved! Looks like everything's still in there too.
Don't EVER do something like this again, or I'll kick your butt six ways from Sunday.
Dammit! I'll getcha for this!
What did I JUST say, huh? *sigh* Maybe I should've handed him over to the authorities and been done with it.
*pant* *wheeze* I'm...I'm here...!
Sorry to leave you in the dust like that, but I've got your wallet, er...
Oh yeah, we didn't exchange names, huh? Well, I'm Nino—thanks for the help.
So what's your name?
My name? My naaaaame...
Ilia!
...Ilia?
Shhh! I told you not to scream my name in public like that!
Terrible news, Ilia! The children have all been kidnapped by Saint Starfall!
...What?
A good number of children went missing last night and in the early hours.
People said they saw a man dressed in red riding on a sleigh along with all the children outside the town...
Red clothes and a sled? Yeah, that'd be Saint Starfall, all right.
The true Saint Starfall would never do something like this. We must save those children from that impostor at once!
Sorry, Nino, but I think our little shopping trip will need to take a back seat.
I hope you find a good present for that Paladyn. Oh, and maybe get back to the inn early tonight—weird people are clearly about.
Wait!
She has the same name as my ancestor...
You said that kidnapper-type was seen over here, Mordecai?
That's what I heard, but I fear the snow has covered up any possible clues.
And now it's dark. Dammit, if we don't find those kids soon, there's no telling what might happen to them...
Ilia! I hear footsteps!
Might be the kidnapper. C'mon!
Damn that girl! I got squat today cause'a her, so I gotta find me some scratch!
That's the pickpocket from earlier.
He's clearly up to something.
Well, he certainly didn't get my message last time, because now he's trying to break into that store!
What are you going to do, Ilia?
I know we're supposed to be finding clues about the kidnapper, but this guy is REALLY torquing my chain...
We can't just ignore something bad happening right in front of us! C'mon!
Crikey, but feedin' all'a them snatched rug rats costs a pretty penny, and no mistake.
HOLD IT RIGHT THERE, BUSTER! JUST WHAT DID YOU MEAN BY THAT?!
Aw, crap! It's that lady what chased me all over hell'n breakfast earlier! Lemme go, ya daft chickadee!
Mordecai? Some help, please.
Of course.
Lemme go... LEMME GO!
You might as well stop struggling. You're not going anywhere.
Now then, what was that little aside you just had about ＂feeding rug rats?＂
I ain't talkin'!
You sure? 'Cause you can either talk to me, or I can drag you over to the local guard and tell them all about your little crime spree.
I'm pretty sure THEIR investigations are much more harsh than mine. Who knows when you'll ever see the outside again after they lock you up?
I'll talk! I'LL TAAAALK!
I was just tryin' to get money what so we could feed all them kids we snatched up!
So you're stealing money in order to feed stolen kids?
Oy, them kids are precious bargaining chips! Can't have 'em keelin' over on us, now can we?
What kind of ＂bargaining chips＂?
We're holdin' all of 'em for ransom, yeah? Their parents are all rich as anything, so once they find their wee darlings are gone, they'll pay through the nose!
Kya ha ha! Easiest plan ever, actually. Them kids'll follow Saint Starfall anywhere durin' Dragonyule, so they will!
Been doin' it for years now, we have, and it's always a right trig business.
Committing crimes on top of crimes is too risky to be a smart business, if you ask me.
Ain't ya never heard'a high risk'n high reward, girlie? We pull this off one day a year and it feeds us the other 364!
Until you are captured in the act as you now have been.
Aw, dry bones to ya both! I done went and spilled me guts, so ya gotta let me go. That was the deal!
That was most specifically NOT the deal. Now show me where your hideout is.
...There it is, ya stubborn arse. That's where all'a them kids be.
Thanks for the help. Now get some sleep.
Buh? WAAAAUGH!
How's it sound in there, Mordecai?
I can hear the children's voices, as well as that of an adult man.
In that case, all that's left is to launch our surprise atta—
Damn Ben always takes ages to get baaaa... Huh? Who the hell are you?!
Right! Plan B: Charge in fists swinging!
Intruders! Seize them!
Mordecai, you take care of the kids while I sort these jokers out!
At once!
Don't let the children escape!
Yes, sir!
You're not getting past me!
HAAAAAH!
You impetuous little—AAAAAUGH!
I don't think you've got the skills to talk and fight at the same time!
Enough of this! Grab the children! Use them as shields!
I won't let you touch them.
Move, damn you!
How long can you withstand our attacks and protect those children, eh?
Nnngh...
Enough of this! Hand the children over, and you may walk out with your lives!
Not happening!
Tch! What the hell are those worthless subordinates of mine doing?!
Sorry, buddy, but they're in dreamland. It's just you against me now.
You smart-mouthed little...
Heh!
You can't dodge me in midair, fool!
Ack!
NOW DIE!
Not today, pal!
She used the blast to right herself? What IS that weapon?!
Mana output at maximum. Going in full throttle!
No! Stay back!
TIME TO CHILL OUT, DUDE!
NOOOOOO!
Ilia! Are you okay?!
Yeah, I'm good. What about the kids?
All well, although quite frightened.
No surprise there... Don't worry, kiddos! We're gonna get you home.
No...
Huh?
I WON'T LET IT END HERE!
(Shoot! I was too slow! He's gonna—!)
ILIA!
Ilia!
I know that voice...
It's Nino!
Haaaah!
Gyaaargh!
Phew! That was a close one. Are you all right, Ilia?
Yeah, thanks to you. But what are you even DOING here?
I kept thinking about you. Going after kidnappers is dangerous work and all.
You were...worried about me?
Yeah, basically... I'd been looking around for you, and then what do I see when I finally find you? You in big trouble!
Heh. Sorry to worry you.
Oh, she's the one from back in town... Is she a friend of yours, Ilia?
Yep. Her name's Nino. Nino, this is Mordecai. He's my...my family.
Thank you for saving Ilia. Also, your wing is beautiful.
My what?
Yeah, what's up with that, anyway?
Ack! I didn't mean to leave it out! So that's...um... Geez, how to explain?
I was just so desperate to help my friend that I...
Hey, that's explanation enough for me. Thanks for the assist, Nino.
Ilia...
Welp, thanks to Nino, we managed to defeat all those lousy kidnappers.
Now you kids really ARE safe, so let's go home for real.
WAAAAAAAAAAH!
WAAAAAAAAAAH!
Why are they crying, Ilia? Aren't they safe?
They were probably too scared to cry until just now.
Don't worry, kiddos. Those bad guys won't ever bother you again.
*sniff* But...Saint Starfall...
What about Saint Starfall?
*sniff* There's no Saint Starfall, is there?
He brought us here...
But then he turned into a scary man!
And when we asked where he went, the scary man said he was all made up.
I was trying to be good for him, but...
They said everyone was lying about Saint Starfall giving us presents! WAAAAAAH!
Kidnapping is bad enough, but did they have to crush their dreams while they were at it?
Easy, children. The Saint Starfall you saw in this place was false.
No! You're a liar like all the other grown-ups!
Yeah, you can't fool us again! There's no Saint Starfall!
OH YES THERE IS!
Er, Ilia?
There IS a Saint Starfall, and he's gonna KEEP bringing presents to all the good children like he always has!
Liar! You're a big, fat, smelly liar!
Okay, that seems unnecessary. Also, how about you wait until tomorrow morning before calling me a liar?
...But why?
Remember how the lady at the Church said Saint Starfall sees when you're good?
All of you are good kids who didn't let the bad men scare you at all.
Saint Starfall will remember that.
Are you sure?
Will he really come?
You bet your bunions he will! Now go home and get some rest already.
Mordecai, can you take these kids home?
Of course. But what about you?
I've got something I have to take care of. I'll meet you back at the inn once I've got it all sorted out.
Are you sure everything will be all right?
Whatcha mean?
You told those kids Saint Starfall was real. Heck, you practically had ME believing it.
Oh, that? Yeah, that's not a problem. I'm just gonna be Saint Starfall myself.
What? How?
Should be obvious enough—I'm gonna throw some presents together and then hand-deliver 'em to their houses.
But it's already dark, and most of the shops are closed.
Then we just have to find some that stay open late or beg the others to reopen.
Why would you go so far for a pack of children you don't even know?
Because there's nothing worse than denying a kid's possibilities.
Nothing good comes from crushing dreams—you gotta grow those puppies!
And as an alchemist, I'm going to keep showing everyone new possibilities.
Because that's going to lead to a better future.
It's the same thing with Saint Starfall.
Telling them that Saint Starfall MIGHT exist will make their tomorrow so much more fun than just admitting he doesn't.
Us adults shouldn't deny them that. We shouldn't rob them of their choices.
So it sounds like you DO have a choice. And all of them are equally valid.
I think I understand.
Please allow me to help, Ilia. I would also like to become Saint Starfall.
Oh man, that'd be GREAT! This'll be so much easier with you helping out!
Now let's go prove that Saint Starfall's real!
Gya?!
Nice one, Nino! You're a natural!
You think so? I've never seen anything like this thing of yours that uses mana to slide along the snow.
It's called a snowboard. Pretty slick invention, if I do say so myself.
Wait. You INVENTED this?
Sure did.
It's amazing you could whip something like this up out of materials we found at the kidnappers' hideout.
And now that I've made it once, I can crank these babies out by the ton!
That's so impressive.
Well, we've got the presents in order. All that's left is to make our deliveries!
When we had to go to a big town to get the presents, I was worried we might not make it—but I think we're gonna pull it off thanks to these snowboards!
I couldn't do it without you helping me out, so seriously, thank—BLARGH!
Ilia?!
Ow! Ow, ow, ow...
Are you okay?
I'm fine, but why the heck did it just break like that? I don't... Oh!
Ack!
That must have weakened it.
I'm glad you're unharmed, but your snowboard...
Yeah, it's kaput, all right.
Can you fix it?
Not likely. I saw a bunch of parts go flying when I wiped out, and finding them here would be a pretty big ask.
(And I highly doubt there's anything we can substitute for those parts just hanging around nearby...)
(Maybe I should just have Nino deliver the presents without me?)
(No, that won't work. We'll only finish in time if we're both on snowboards.)
(Think, lady! Think! There's gotta be something to get us outta this mess!)
Ilia, you should use my board.
I appreciate the sentiment, but we can't deliver all of these with just one of us.
I know. That's why I want you to use it.
See, 'cause...I have a wing.
Whoa! Hang on, are you sure?
You looked pretty shaken when it came up earlier, so I figured you didn't want anyone to see it.
I'd be lying if I said I wasn't afraid of people seeing it...
But I can't ignore a friend in need, and I won't use that as an excuse to do so.
Aw, Nino!
With my wing out, I can match your speed on your snowboard. Now let's quit talking and just do this already!
Right. Let's get this show on the road!
Saint Starfall came!
He came to my house too! He really WAS watching over us this whole time!
Look! Saint Starfall came for me as well!
That's great, Mordecai!
Saint Starfall's real! He's really real!
Hey, you're that nice man from yesterday!
Did Saint Starfall come to your house too, mister?
He certainly did—and he left this by my pillow!
Ooo! What a pretty little bird!
Hey, we should all show off our presents!
Well, the kids certainly seem fond of him. That's the one you were buying a present for, right?
Sure is—and I was pretty worried about what to get him too.
But turns out he's just thrilled to get a present in the first place. It's a real weight off my shoulders, lemme tell you.
And mine as well. Thanks to this, I feel confident I can give my present too.
Did you finally manage to find something for that picky Paladyn of yours?
I did indeed. He told me he likes to read, so I got him an embroidered bookmark.
Oh, that's a GREAT gift! Those reader-types can never have enough bookmarks.
Thank you. ...Say, Ilia?
What's up?
Are you not going to ask about my wing? Don't you think it's odd that a human would have one?
Hey, it's not like a wing or three is gonna change how we feel about each other.
And I'd never force a friend to talk about something they're uncomfortable with.
Besides...
Yes?
You haven't asked about my name either!
It gets complicated having the same name as the Goddess, so I try to keep it on the down-low as much as I can.
I completely understand that feeling.
Heh. This is just like when we first met.
Back then, we were both worried about what presents to get, and now we're trying to hold on to our secrets!
We really are alike!
Ha! Yeah, we sure are.
And while there are so many things I'd like to talk to you about...I should go.
Got a final present to deliver, eh?
After all the effort I went to picking it out, it would be a shame not to deliver it.
Can we see each other again, Ilia?
The Goddess will make sure of it.
Well then, have a merry Dragonyule.
I know we'll see each other again. After all, she brought us together.
(Nino is your descendant, right, Meene?)
(That beautiful wing was just like yours. It really brought me back...)
Hello, Ilia. Where's Nino?
Oh, she's already gone on her way.
Aw. I wanted to show her my present.
Did Saint Starfall visit you, Ilia?
He sure did—and he came with the best present in the world.
(To think she'd send me a friend a thousand years in the future... Heh. That really is just like Meene.)
Thank you, my Saint Starfall.
